title: How to Keep Refried Beans in Your System Longer

steps.headline: Combine beans with a starch.
steps.description: Do not eat beans alone. In a sandwich, use whole wheat bread or a multi-grain bread with a minimal amount of processed flour; the same goes with tortillas - use whole wheat tortillas. Potatoes and beans is the best combination for maximum digestion of beans

steps.headline: Premix refried beans with some grated carrots.
steps.description: Scrub the carrots, but do not peel off the skin. The outer layer of carrots have the most nutrition and fiber. To match the texture of carrots to beans, cook the carrots slightly either separately or together with the beans.

steps.headline: Premix refried beans with some banana chips or dried bananas.
steps.description: Break the banana chips into little pieces and if using dried bananas, chop them in little pieces. Add a tiny bit of water to the mixture, and give the banana chips some time to soften. Bananas, more than carrots, go through your system slowly.

steps.headline: Explore different varieties of beans.
steps.description: Instead of pinto beans, use a potato masher and try other beans.

steps.headline: Store refried beans in a microwaveable bowl with a cover.
steps.description: Then re-heat them to prolong usability.
